017package squidpony.squidgrid.gui.gdx;
018
019import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Color;
020import com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.g2d.Batch;
021import com.badlogic.gdx.math.Frustum;
022import com.badlogic.gdx.math.MathUtils;
023import com.badlogic.gdx.utils.GdxRuntimeException;
024import squidpony.StringKit;
025import squidpony.squidmath.HashCommon;
026import squidpony.squidmath.NumberTools;
027
028import java.util.Iterator;
029import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
030
031/**
032 * An unordered map where the keys are two positive ints up to 16 bits (x and y, between 0 and 65535) and there are
033 * multiple kinds of value per key, here just a char and a float for color. Can be rendered if given a running Batch
034 * and a TextCellFactory using {@link #draw(Batch, TextCellFactory, Frustum)}.
035 * <br>
036 *
037 * @author Nathan Sweet
038 * @author Tommy Ettinger
039 */
040public class SparseTextMap implements Iterable<SparseTextMap.Entry> {
041    private static final int PRIME2 = 0x1EBF69;//0xb4b82e39;
042    private static final int PRIME3 = 0x1A3491;//0xced1c241;
043    private static final int EMPTY = 0;
044
045    public int size;
046
047    private int[] keyTable;
048    private char[] charValueTable;
049    private float[] floatValueTable;
050    private int capacity, stashSize;
051    private char zeroChar;
052    private float zeroFloat;
053    private boolean hasZeroValue;
054
055    private float loadFactor;
056    private int hashShift, mask, threshold;
057    private int stashCapacity;
058    private int pushIterations;
059
060    private transient Entries entries1, entries2;
061    private transient CharValues charValues1, charValues2;
062    private transient FloatValues floatValues1, floatValues2;
063    private transient Keys keys1, keys2;
064
065    /**
066     * Creates a new map with an initial capacity of 51 and a load factor of 0.55.
067     */
068    public SparseTextMap() {
069        this(63, 0.55f);
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * Creates a new map with a load factor of 0.55.
074     *
075     * @param initialCapacity If not a power of two, it is increased to the next nearest power of two.
076     */
077    public SparseTextMap(int initialCapacity) {
078        this(initialCapacity, 0.55f);
079    }
080
081    /**
082     * Creates a new map with the specified initial capacity and load factor. This map will hold initialCapacity items before
083     * growing the backing table.
084     *
085     * @param initialCapacity If not a power of two, it is increased to the next nearest power of two.
086     */
087    public SparseTextMap(int initialCapacity, float loadFactor) {
088        if (initialCapacity < 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException("initialCapacity must be >= 0: " + initialCapacity);
089        initialCapacity = HashCommon.nextPowerOfTwo((int) Math.ceil(initialCapacity / loadFactor));
090        if (initialCapacity > 1 << 30)
091            throw new IllegalArgumentException("initialCapacity is too large: " + initialCapacity);
092        capacity = initialCapacity;
093
094        if (loadFactor <= 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException("loadFactor must be > 0: " + loadFactor);
095        this.loadFactor = loadFactor;
096
097        threshold = (int) (capacity * loadFactor);
098        mask = capacity - 1;
099        hashShift = 31 - Integer.numberOfTrailingZeros(capacity);
100        stashCapacity = Math.max(3, (int) Math.ceil(Math.log(capacity)) * 2);
101        pushIterations = Math.max(Math.min(capacity, 8), (int) Math.sqrt(capacity) / 8);
102
103        keyTable = new int[capacity + stashCapacity];
104        charValueTable = new char[keyTable.length];
105        floatValueTable = new float[keyTable.length];
106    }
107
108    /**
109     * Creates a new map identical to the specified map.
110     */
111    public SparseTextMap(SparseTextMap map) {
112        //this((int) Math.floor(map.capacity * map.loadFactor), map.loadFactor);
113        capacity = map.capacity;
114        loadFactor = map.loadFactor;
115        threshold = map.threshold;
116        mask = map.mask;
117        hashShift = map.hashShift;
118        stashCapacity = map.stashCapacity;
119        pushIterations = map.pushIterations;
120        stashSize = map.stashSize;
121        keyTable = new int[map.keyTable.length];
122        System.arraycopy(map.keyTable, 0, keyTable, 0, map.keyTable.length);
123        charValueTable = new char[map.charValueTable.length];
124        System.arraycopy(map.charValueTable, 0, charValueTable, 0, map.charValueTable.length);
125        floatValueTable = new float[map.floatValueTable.length];
126        System.arraycopy(map.floatValueTable, 0, floatValueTable, 0, map.floatValueTable.length);
127        size = map.size;
128        zeroChar = map.zeroChar;
129        zeroFloat = map.zeroFloat;
130        hasZeroValue = map.hasZeroValue;
131    }
132
133    /**
134     * Draws the contents of this SparseTextMap, using the keys as x,y pairs as they would be entered by calling
135     * {@link #place(int, int, char, float)} and drawing the associated char at that x,y position. Uses a
136     * {@link Frustum} object, usually obtained from the current Camera with
137     * {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera#frustum}, to cull anything that would be drawn out of view. Treats the
138     * float value as a color for the char, using the encoding for colors as floats that {@link Color#toFloatBits()}
139     * uses. Relies on the sizing information from the given TextCellFactory (its
140     * {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellWidth} and {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellHeight}, which may differ from its
141     * width and height if either of {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} or
142     * {@link TextCellFactory#tweakHeight(float)} were called). It also, of course, uses the TextCellFactory to
143     * determine what its text will look like (font, size, and so on). The TextCellFactory must have been initialized,
144     * probably with {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()} after setting the width and height as desired. This method
145     * should be called between {@code batch.begin()} and {@code batch.end()} with the Batch passed to this.
146     *
147     * @param batch       the {@link FilterBatch} or other Batch used to draw this; should have already have had begin() called
148     * @param textFactory used to determine the font, size, cell size, and other information; must be initialized
149     */
150    public void draw(Batch batch, TextCellFactory textFactory) {
151        draw(batch, textFactory, 0f, 0f);
152    }
153    /**
154     * Draws the contents of this SparseTextMap, using the keys as x,y pairs as they would be entered by calling
155     * {@link #place(int, int, char, float)} and drawing the associated char at that x,y position, potentially with an
156     * offset on x and/or y. Uses a {@link Frustum} object, usually obtained from the current Camera with
157     * {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera#frustum}, to cull anything that would be drawn out of view. Treats the
158     * float value as a color for the char, using the encoding for colors as floats that {@link Color#toFloatBits()}
159     * uses. Relies on the sizing information from the given TextCellFactory (its
160     * {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellWidth} and {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellHeight}, which may differ from its
161     * width and height if either of {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} or
162     * {@link TextCellFactory#tweakHeight(float)} were called). It also, of course, uses the TextCellFactory to
163     * determine what its text will look like (font, size, and so on). The TextCellFactory must have been initialized,
164     * probably with {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()} after setting the width and height as desired. This method
165     * should be called between {@code batch.begin()} and {@code batch.end()} with the Batch passed to this.
166     *
167     * @param batch       the {@link FilterBatch} or other Batch used to draw this; should have already have had begin() called
168     * @param textFactory used to determine the font, size, cell size, and other information; must be initialized
169     * @param screenOffsetX offset to apply to the x position of each char rendered; positive moves chars right
170     * @param screenOffsetY offset to apply to the y position of each char rendered; positive moves chars up
171     */
172    public void draw(Batch batch, TextCellFactory textFactory, float screenOffsetX, float screenOffsetY) {
173        //textFactory.configureShader(batch);
174        final float widthInc = textFactory.actualCellWidth, heightInc = -textFactory.actualCellHeight;
175        int n;
176        for (Entry entry : entries()) {
177            n = entry.key;
178            n ^= n >>> 16;
179            n *= 0xA123B;
180//            n ^= n << 26;
181//            n ^= n >>> 15;
182//            n ^= n << 17;
183            textFactory.draw(batch, entry.charValue, entry.floatValue,
184                    (n & 0xFFFF) * widthInc + screenOffsetX, (n >>> 16) * heightInc + screenOffsetY);
185        }
186    }
187    /**
188     * Draws the contents of this SparseTextMap, using the keys as x,y pairs as they would be entered by calling
189     * {@link #place(int, int, char, float)} and drawing the associated char at that x,y position. Uses a
190     * {@link Frustum} object, usually obtained from the current Camera with
191     * {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera#frustum}, to cull anything that would be drawn out of view. Treats the
192     * float value as a color for the char, using the encoding for colors as floats that {@link Color#toFloatBits()}
193     * uses. Relies on the sizing information from the given TextCellFactory (its
194     * {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellWidth} and {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellHeight}, which may differ from its
195     * width and height if either of {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} or
196     * {@link TextCellFactory#tweakHeight(float)} were called). It also, of course, uses the TextCellFactory to
197     * determine what its text will look like (font, size, and so on). The TextCellFactory must have been initialized,
198     * probably with {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()} after setting the width and height as desired. This method
199     * should be called between {@code batch.begin()} and {@code batch.end()} with the Batch passed to this.
200     *
201     * @param batch       the {@link FilterBatch} or other Batch used to draw this; should have already have had begin() called
202     * @param textFactory used to determine the font, size, cell size, and other information; must be initialized
203     * @param frustum     a {@link Frustum} object to determine culling, almost always obtained from {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera#frustum}
204     */
205    public void draw(Batch batch, TextCellFactory textFactory, Frustum frustum) {
206        draw(batch, textFactory, frustum, 0f, 0f);
207    }
208    /**
209     * Draws the contents of this SparseTextMap, using the keys as x,y pairs as they would be entered by calling
210     * {@link #place(int, int, char, float)} and drawing the associated char at that x,y position, potentially with an
211     * offset on x and/or y. Uses a {@link Frustum} object, usually obtained from the current Camera with
212     * {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera#frustum}, to cull anything that would be drawn out of view. Treats the
213     * float value as a color for the char, using the encoding for colors as floats that {@link Color#toFloatBits()}
214     * uses. Relies on the sizing information from the given TextCellFactory (its
215     * {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellWidth} and {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellHeight}, which may differ from its
216     * width and height if either of {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} or
217     * {@link TextCellFactory#tweakHeight(float)} were called). It also, of course, uses the TextCellFactory to
218     * determine what its text will look like (font, size, and so on). The TextCellFactory must have been initialized,
219     * probably with {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()} after setting the width and height as desired. This method
220     * should be called between {@code batch.begin()} and {@code batch.end()} with the Batch passed to this.
221     *
222     * @param batch       the {@link FilterBatch} or other Batch used to draw this; should have already have had begin() called
223     * @param textFactory used to determine the font, size, cell size, and other information; must be initialized
224     * @param frustum     a {@link Frustum} object to determine culling, almost always obtained from {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera#frustum}
225     * @param screenOffsetX offset to apply to the x position of each char rendered; positive moves chars right
226     * @param screenOffsetY offset to apply to the y position of each char rendered; positive moves chars up
227     */
228    public void draw(Batch batch, TextCellFactory textFactory, Frustum frustum, float screenOffsetX, float screenOffsetY) {
229        //textFactory.configureShader(batch);
230        final float widthInc = textFactory.actualCellWidth, heightInc = -textFactory.actualCellHeight;
231        float x, y;
232        int n;
233        for (Entry entry : entries()) {
234            n = entry.key;
235            n ^= n >>> 16;
236            n *= 0xA123B;
237//            n ^= n << 26;
238//            n ^= n >>> 15;
239//            n ^= n << 17;
240            x = (n & 0xFFFF) * widthInc + screenOffsetX;
241            y = (n >>> 16) * heightInc + screenOffsetY;
242            if(frustum.boundsInFrustum(x, y, 0f, widthInc, -heightInc, 0f))
243                textFactory.draw(batch, entry.charValue, entry.floatValue, x, y);
244        }
245    }
246
247    /**
248     * Draws the contents of this SparseTextMap, using the keys as x,y pairs as they would be entered by calling
249     * {@link #place(int, int, char, float)} and drawing the char replacement at that x,y position, potentially with an
250     * offset on x and/or y. Uses a {@link Frustum} object, usually obtained from the current Camera with
251     * {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera#frustum}, to cull anything that would be drawn out of view. Treats the
252     * float value as a color for replacement, using the encoding for colors as floats that {@link Color#toFloatBits()}
253     * uses. Relies on the sizing information from the given TextCellFactory (its
254     * {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellWidth} and {@link TextCellFactory#actualCellHeight}, which may differ from its
255     * width and height if either of {@link TextCellFactory#tweakWidth(float)} or
256     * {@link TextCellFactory#tweakHeight(float)} were called). It also, of course, uses the TextCellFactory to
257     * determine what its text will look like (font, size, and so on). The TextCellFactory must have been initialized,
258     * probably with {@link TextCellFactory#initBySize()} after setting the width and height as desired. This method
259     * should be called between {@code batch.begin()} and {@code batch.end()} with the Batch passed to this.
260     *
261     * @param batch       the {@link FilterBatch} or other Batch used to draw this; should have already have had begin() called
262     * @param textFactory used to determine the font, size, cell size, and other information; must be initialized
263     * @param frustum     a {@link Frustum} object to determine culling, almost always obtained from {@link com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Camera#frustum}
264     * @param screenOffsetX offset to apply to the x position of each char rendered; positive moves chars right
265     * @param screenOffsetY offset to apply to the y position of each char rendered; positive moves chars up
266     * @param replacement a char that will be used in place of the normal char values stored in this; often the char
267     *                    with Unicode value 0, which renders as a solid block.
268     */
269    public void draw(Batch batch, TextCellFactory textFactory, Frustum frustum, float screenOffsetX, float screenOffsetY, char replacement) {
270        //textFactory.configureShader(batch);
271        final float widthInc = textFactory.actualCellWidth, heightInc = -textFactory.actualCellHeight;
272        float x, y;
273        int n;
274        for (Entry entry : entries()) {
275            n = entry.key;
276            n ^= n >>> 16;
277            n *= 0xA123B;
278//            n ^= n << 26;
279//            n ^= n >>> 15;
280//            n ^= n << 17;
281//            n =    ((n & 0x22222222) << 1) | ((n >>> 1) & 0x22222222) | (n & 0x99999999);
282//            n =    ((n & 0x0c0c0c0c) << 2) | ((n >>> 2) & 0x0c0c0c0c) | (n & 0xc3c3c3c3);
283//            n =    ((n & 0x00f000f0) << 4) | ((n >>> 4) & 0x00f000f0) | (n & 0xf00ff00f);
284//            n =    ((n & 0x0000ff00) << 8) | ((n >>> 8) & 0x0000ff00) | (n & 0xff0000ff);
285            x = (n & 0xFFFF) * widthInc + screenOffsetX;
286            y = (n >>> 16) * heightInc + screenOffsetY;
287            if(frustum.boundsInFrustum(x, y, 0f, widthInc, -heightInc, 0f)) 
288                textFactory.draw(batch, replacement, entry.floatValue, x, y);
289        }
290    }
291
292    /**
293     * Packs the given x,y position into one int in the type that is used elsewhere in this class.
294     * This requires x and y to each be between 0 and 65535, both inclusive.
295     *
296     * @param x the x component to encode; this must be between 0 and 65535, both inclusive
297     * @param y the y component to encode; this must be between 0 and 65535, both inclusive
298     * @return an encoded form of the x,y pair in the style used elsewhere in this class
299     */
300    public static int encodePosition(final int x, final int y) {
301        final int n = (x | y << 16) * 0x4F6F3;
302        return n ^ n >>> 16;
303
304//        n ^= n << 17;
305//        n ^= n >>> 15;
306//        n ^= n >>> 30;
307//        return n ^ n << 26;
308        //return GreasedRegion.interleaveBits(x, y);
309    }
310
311    /**
312     * Decodes a packed position and gets the x component from it, if it was produced by
313     * {@link #encodePosition(int, int)} or {@link #place(int, int, char, float)}.
314     *
315     * @param encoded a packed position that holds x and y components
316     * @return the x component packed in the parameter
317     */
318    public static int decodeX(final int encoded) {
319        return ((encoded ^ encoded >>> 16) * 0xA123B) & 0xFFFF;
320//        encoded ^= encoded << 26;
321//        return (encoded ^ encoded >>> 15) & 0xFFFF;
322        //return GreasedRegion.disperseBits(encoded) & 0xFFFF;
323    }
324
325    /**
326     * Decodes a packed position and gets the y component from it, if it was produced by
327     * {@link #encodePosition(int, int)} or {@link #place(int, int, char, float)}.
328     *
329     * @param encoded a packed position that holds x and y components
330     * @return the y component packed in the parameter
331     */
332    public static int decodeY(final int encoded) {
333        return ((encoded ^ encoded >>> 16) * 0xA123B) >>> 16;
334//        encoded ^= encoded << 26;
335//        encoded ^= encoded >>> 15;
336//        return (encoded ^ encoded << 17) >>> 16;
337        //return GreasedRegion.disperseBits(encoded) >>> 16;
338    }
339
340    /**
341     * Places a char in the given libGDX Color at the requested x, y position in grid cells, where x and y must each be
342     * between 0 and 65535, both inclusive. The color can also be an SColor, such as one of the many constants in that
343     * class. Returns the int code that can be used to locate the x,y pair as a key in this SparseTextMap.
344     *
345     * @param x         the x position of the colorful char; this must be between 0 and 65535, both inclusive
346     * @param y         the y position of the colorful char; this must be between 0 and 65535, both inclusive
347     * @param charValue the char to put into the SparseTextMap
348     * @param color     the libGDX Color or SColor to use for the char
349     * @return the int that the x,y pair will be stored at, and used as the single key associated with the colorful char
350     */
351    public int place(int x, int y, char charValue, Color color) {
352        return place(x, y, charValue, color.toFloatBits());
353    }
354
355    /**
356     * Places a char in the given encoded color at the requested x, y position in grid cells, where x and y must each be
357     * between 0 and 65535, both inclusive, and the encoded color is one produced by {@link Color#toFloatBits()} or any
358     * of several methods in {@link SColor}, such as {@link SColor#floatGetI(int, int, int)},
359     * {@link SColor#floatGetHSV(float, float, float, float)}, or {@link SColor#lerpFloatColors(float, float, float)}.
360     * Returns the int code that can be used to locate the x,y pair as a key in this SparseTextMap.
361     *
362     * @param x            the x position of the colorful char; this must be between 0 and 65535, both inclusive
363     * @param y            the y position of the colorful char; this must be between 0 and 65535, both inclusive
364     * @param charValue    the char to put into the SparseTextMap
365     * @param encodedColor the encoded color to use for the char, as produced by {@link Color#toFloatBits()}
366     * @return the int that the x,y pair will be stored at, and used as the single key associated with the colorful char
367     */
368    public int place(int x, int y, char charValue, float encodedColor) {
369        int code = encodePosition(x, y);
370        put(code, charValue, encodedColor);
371        return code;
372    }
373
374    public void put(int key, char charValue, float floatValue) {
375        if (key == 0) {
376            zeroChar = charValue;
377            zeroFloat = floatValue;
378            if (!hasZeroValue) {
379                hasZeroValue = true;
380                size++;
381            }
382            return;
383        }
384
385        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
386
387        // Check for existing keys.
388        int index1 = key & mask;
389        int key1 = keyTable[index1];
390        if (key == key1) {
391            charValueTable[index1] = charValue;
392            floatValueTable[index1] = floatValue;
393            return;
394        }
395
396        int index2 = hash2(key);
397        int key2 = keyTable[index2];
398        if (key == key2) {
399            charValueTable[index2] = charValue;
400            floatValueTable[index2] = floatValue;
401            return;
402        }
403
404        int index3 = hash3(key);
405        int key3 = keyTable[index3];
406        if (key == key3) {
407            charValueTable[index3] = charValue;
408            floatValueTable[index3] = floatValue;
409            return;
410        }
411
412        // Update key in the stash.
413        for (int i = capacity, n = i + stashSize; i < n; i++) {
414            if (key == keyTable[i]) {
415                charValueTable[i] = charValue;
416                floatValueTable[i] = floatValue;
417                return;
418            }
419        }
420
421        // Check for empty buckets.
422        if (key1 == EMPTY) {
423            keyTable[index1] = key;
424            charValueTable[index1] = charValue;
425            floatValueTable[index1] = floatValue;
426            if (size++ >= threshold) resize(capacity << 1);
427            return;
428        }
429
430        if (key2 == EMPTY) {
431            keyTable[index2] = key;
432            charValueTable[index2] = charValue;
433            floatValueTable[index2] = floatValue;
434            if (size++ >= threshold) resize(capacity << 1);
435            return;
436        }
437
438        if (key3 == EMPTY) {
439            keyTable[index3] = key;
440            charValueTable[index3] = charValue;
441            floatValueTable[index3] = floatValue;
442            if (size++ >= threshold) resize(capacity << 1);
443            return;
444        }
445
446        push(key, charValue, floatValue, index1, key1, index2, key2, index3, key3);
447    }
448
449    /**
450     * If and only if key is already present, this changes the float associated with it while leaving the char the same.
451     * @param key the encoded key as produced by {@link #encodePosition(int, int)}
452     * @param floatValue
453     */
454    public void updateFloat(int key, float floatValue)
455    {
456        if (key == 0 && hasZeroValue) {
457            //zeroChar = charValue;
458            zeroFloat = floatValue;
459            return;
460        }
461
462        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
463
464        // Check for existing keys.
465        int index1 = key & mask;
466        int key1 = keyTable[index1];
467        if (key == key1) {
468            //charValueTable[index1] = charValue;
469            floatValueTable[index1] = floatValue;
470            return;
471        }
472
473        int index2 = hash2(key);
474        int key2 = keyTable[index2];
475        if (key == key2) {
476            //charValueTable[index2] = charValue;
477            floatValueTable[index2] = floatValue;
478            return;
479        }
480
481        int index3 = hash3(key);
482        int key3 = keyTable[index3];
483        if (key == key3) {
484            //charValueTable[index3] = charValue;
485            floatValueTable[index3] = floatValue;
486            return;
487        }
488
489        // Update key in the stash.
490        for (int i = capacity, n = i + stashSize; i < n; i++) {
491            if (key == keyTable[i]) {
492                //charValueTable[i] = charValue;
493                floatValueTable[i] = floatValue;
494                return;
495            }
496        }
497    }
498
499    public void updateChar(int key, char charValue)
500    {
501        if (key == 0 && hasZeroValue) {
502            zeroChar = charValue;
503            //zeroFloat = floatValue;
504            return;
505        }
506
507        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
508
509        // Check for existing keys.
510        int index1 = key & mask;
511        int key1 = keyTable[index1];
512        if (key == key1) {
513            charValueTable[index1] = charValue;
514            //floatValueTable[index1] = floatValue;
515            return;
516        }
517
518        int index2 = hash2(key);
519        int key2 = keyTable[index2];
520        if (key == key2) {
521            charValueTable[index2] = charValue;
522            //floatValueTable[index2] = floatValue;
523            return;
524        }
525
526        int index3 = hash3(key);
527        int key3 = keyTable[index3];
528        if (key == key3) {
529            charValueTable[index3] = charValue;
530            //floatValueTable[index3] = floatValue;
531            return;
532        }
533
534        // Update key in the stash.
535        for (int i = capacity, n = i + stashSize; i < n; i++) {
536            if (key == keyTable[i]) {
537                charValueTable[i] = charValue;
538                //floatValueTable[i] = floatValue;
539                return;
540            }
541        }
542    }
543
544    public void putAll(SparseTextMap map) {
545        for (Entry entry : map.entries())
546            put(entry.key, entry.charValue, entry.floatValue);
547    }
548
549    /**
550     * Skips checks for existing keys.
551     */
552    private void putResize(int key, char charValue, float floatValue) {
553        if (key == 0) {
554            zeroChar = charValue;
555            zeroFloat = floatValue;
556            hasZeroValue = true;
557            return;
558        }
559
560        // Check for empty buckets.
561        int index1 = key & mask;
562        int key1 = keyTable[index1];
563        if (key1 == EMPTY) {
564            keyTable[index1] = key;
565            charValueTable[index1] = charValue;
566            floatValueTable[index1] = floatValue;
567            if (size++ >= threshold) resize(capacity << 1);
568            return;
569        }
570
571        int index2 = hash2(key);
572        int key2 = keyTable[index2];
573        if (key2 == EMPTY) {
574            keyTable[index2] = key;
575            charValueTable[index2] = charValue;
576            floatValueTable[index2] = floatValue;
577            if (size++ >= threshold) resize(capacity << 1);
578            return;
579        }
580
581        int index3 = hash3(key);
582        int key3 = keyTable[index3];
583        if (key3 == EMPTY) {
584            keyTable[index3] = key;
585            charValueTable[index3] = charValue;
586            floatValueTable[index3] = floatValue;
587            if (size++ >= threshold) resize(capacity << 1);
588            return;
589        }
590
591        push(key, charValue, floatValue, index1, key1, index2, key2, index3, key3);
592    }
593
594    private void push(int insertKey, char insertChar, float insertFloat, int index1, int key1, int index2, int key2, int index3, int key3) {
595        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
596        char[] charTable = this.charValueTable;
597        float[] floatTable = this.floatValueTable;
598        int mask = this.mask;
599
600        // Push keys until an empty bucket is found.
601        int evictedKey;
602        char evictedChar;
603        float evictedFloat;
604        int i = 0, pushIterations = this.pushIterations;
605        do {
606            // Replace the key and value for one of the hashes.
607            switch (MathUtils.random(2)) {
608                case 0:
609                    evictedKey = key1;
610                    evictedChar = charTable[index1];
611                    evictedFloat = floatTable[index1];
612                    keyTable[index1] = insertKey;
613                    charTable[index1] = insertChar;
614                    floatTable[index1] = insertFloat;
615                    break;
616                case 1:
617                    evictedKey = key2;
618                    evictedChar = charTable[index2];
619                    evictedFloat = floatTable[index2];
620                    keyTable[index2] = insertKey;
621                    charTable[index2] = insertChar;
622                    floatTable[index2] = insertFloat;
623                    break;
624                default:
625                    evictedKey = key3;
626                    evictedChar = charTable[index3];
627                    evictedFloat = floatTable[index3];
628                    keyTable[index3] = insertKey;
629                    charTable[index3] = insertChar;
630                    floatTable[index3] = insertFloat;
631                    break;
632            }
633
634            // If the evicted key hashes to an empty bucket, put it there and stop.
635            index1 = evictedKey & mask;
636            key1 = keyTable[index1];
637            if (key1 == EMPTY) {
638                keyTable[index1] = evictedKey;
639                charTable[index1] = evictedChar;
640                floatTable[index1] = evictedFloat;
641                if (size++ >= threshold) resize(capacity << 1);
642                return;
643            }
644
645            index2 = hash2(evictedKey);
646            key2 = keyTable[index2];
647            if (key2 == EMPTY) {
648                keyTable[index2] = evictedKey;
649                charTable[index2] = evictedChar;
650                floatTable[index2] = evictedFloat;
651                if (size++ >= threshold) resize(capacity << 1);
652                return;
653            }
654
655            index3 = hash3(evictedKey);
656            key3 = keyTable[index3];
657            if (key3 == EMPTY) {
658                keyTable[index3] = evictedKey;
659                charTable[index3] = evictedChar;
660                floatTable[index3] = evictedFloat;
661                if (size++ >= threshold) resize(capacity << 1);
662                return;
663            }
664
665            if (++i == pushIterations) break;
666
667            insertKey = evictedKey;
668            insertChar = evictedChar;
669            insertFloat = evictedFloat;
670        } while (true);
671
672        putStash(evictedKey, evictedChar, evictedFloat);
673    }
674
675    private void putStash(int key, char charValue, float floatValue) {
676        if (stashSize == stashCapacity) {
677            // Too many pushes occurred and the stash is full, increase the table size.
678            resize(capacity << 1);
679            put(key, charValue, floatValue);
680            return;
681        }
682        // Store key in the stash.
683        int index = capacity + stashSize;
684        keyTable[index] = key;
685        charValueTable[index] = charValue;
686        floatValueTable[index] = floatValue;
687        stashSize++;
688        size++;
689    }
690    /**
691     * @param x the x-component of the position to look up 
692     * @param y the y-component of the position to look up
693     * @param defaultValue Returned if the key was not associated with a value.
694     * @return the char associated with the given position, or defaultValue if no char is associated
695     */
696    public char getChar(int x, int y, char defaultValue) {
697        return getChar(encodePosition(x, y), defaultValue);
698    }
699
700    /**
701     * @param key the encoded key as produced by {@link #encodePosition(int, int)}
702     * @param defaultValue Returned if the key was not associated with a value.
703     * @return the char associated with the given key, or defaultValue if no char is associated
704     */
705    public char getChar(int key, char defaultValue) {
706        if (key == 0) {
707            if (!hasZeroValue) return defaultValue;
708            return zeroChar;
709        }
710        int index = key & mask;
711        if (keyTable[index] != key) {
712            index = hash2(key);
713            if (keyTable[index] != key) {
714                index = hash3(key);
715                if (keyTable[index] != key) return getStashChar(key, defaultValue);
716            }
717        }
718        return charValueTable[index];
719    }
720
721    private char getStashChar(int key, char defaultValue) {
722        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
723        for (int i = capacity, n = i + stashSize; i < n; i++)
724            if (key == keyTable[i]) return charValueTable[i];
725        return defaultValue;
726    }
727
728    /**
729     * @param x the x-component of the position to look up 
730     * @param y the y-component of the position to look up
731     * @param defaultValue Returned if the key was not associated with a value.
732     * @return the float associated with the given position, or defaultValue if no float is associated
733     */
734    public float getFloat(int x, int y, float defaultValue) {
735        return getFloat(encodePosition(x, y), defaultValue);
736    }
737
738    /**
739     * @param key the encoded key as produced by {@link #encodePosition(int, int)}
740     * @param defaultValue Returned if the key was not associated with a value.
741     * @return the float associated with the given key, or defaultValue if no float is associated
742     */
743    public float getFloat(int key, float defaultValue) {
744        if (key == 0) {
745            if (!hasZeroValue) return defaultValue;
746            return zeroFloat;
747        }
748        int index = key & mask;
749        if (keyTable[index] != key) {
750            index = hash2(key);
751            if (keyTable[index] != key) {
752                index = hash3(key);
753                if (keyTable[index] != key) return getStashFloat(key, defaultValue);
754            }
755        }
756        return floatValueTable[index];
757    }
758
759    private float getStashFloat(int key, float defaultValue) {
760        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
761        for (int i = capacity, n = i + stashSize; i < n; i++)
762            if (key == keyTable[i]) return floatValueTable[i];
763        return defaultValue;
764    }
765
766    public void remove(int key) {
767        remove(key, '#');
768    }
769
770    public char remove(int key, char defaultValue) {
771        if (key == 0) {
772            if (!hasZeroValue) return defaultValue;
773            hasZeroValue = false;
774            size--;
775            return zeroChar;
776        }
777
778        int index = key & mask;
779        if (key == keyTable[index]) {
780            keyTable[index] = EMPTY;
781            char oldValue = charValueTable[index];
782            size--;
783            return oldValue;
784        }
785
786        index = hash2(key);
787        if (key == keyTable[index]) {
788            keyTable[index] = EMPTY;
789            char oldValue = charValueTable[index];
790            size--;
791            return oldValue;
792        }
793
794        index = hash3(key);
795        if (key == keyTable[index]) {
796            keyTable[index] = EMPTY;
797            char oldValue = charValueTable[index];
798            size--;
799            return oldValue;
800        }
801
802        return removeStash(key, defaultValue);
803    }
804
805    private char removeStash(int key, char defaultValue) {
806        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
807        for (int i = capacity, n = i + stashSize; i < n; i++) {
808            if (key == keyTable[i]) {
809                char oldValue = charValueTable[i];
810                removeStashIndex(i);
811                size--;
812                return oldValue;
813            }
814        }
815        return defaultValue;
816    }
817
818    private void removeStashIndex(int index) {
819        // If the removed location was not last, move the last tuple to the removed location.
820        stashSize--;
821        int lastIndex = capacity + stashSize;
822        if (index < lastIndex) {
823            keyTable[index] = keyTable[lastIndex];
824            charValueTable[index] = charValueTable[lastIndex];
825        }
826    }
827
828    /**
829     * Reduces the size of the backing arrays to be the specified capacity or less. If the capacity is already less, nothing is
830     * done. If the map contains more items than the specified capacity, the next highest power of two capacity is used instead.
831     */
832    public void shrink(int maximumCapacity) {
833        if (maximumCapacity < 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException("maximumCapacity must be >= 0: " + maximumCapacity);
834        if (size > maximumCapacity) maximumCapacity = size;
835        if (capacity <= maximumCapacity) return;
836        maximumCapacity = HashCommon.nextPowerOfTwo(maximumCapacity);
837        resize(maximumCapacity);
838    }
839
840    /**
841     * Clears the map and reduces the size of the backing arrays to be the specified capacity if they are larger.
842     */
843    public void clear(int maximumCapacity) {
844        if (capacity <= maximumCapacity) {
845            clear();
846            return;
847        }
848        hasZeroValue = false;
849        size = 0;
850        resize(maximumCapacity);
851    }
852
853    public void clear() {
854        if (size == 0) return;
855        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
856        for (int i = capacity + stashSize; i-- > 0; )
857            keyTable[i] = EMPTY;
858        size = 0;
859        stashSize = 0;
860        hasZeroValue = false;
861    }
862
863    /**
864     * Returns true if the specified char value is in the map. Note: this traverses the entire map and compares every
865     * value, which may be an expensive operation.
866     */
867    public boolean containsCharValue(char value) {
868        if (hasZeroValue && zeroChar == value) return true;
869        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
870        char[] valueTable = this.charValueTable;
871        for (int i = capacity + stashSize; i-- > 0; )
872            if (keyTable[i] != 0 && valueTable[i] == value) return true;
873        return false;
874    }
875
876    /**
877     * Returns true if the specified char value is in the map. Note: this traverses the entire map and compares every
878     * value, which may be an expensive operation.
879     */
880    public boolean containsFloatValue(float value) {
881        if (hasZeroValue && zeroFloat == value) return true;
882        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
883        float[] valueTable = this.floatValueTable;
884        for (int i = capacity + stashSize; i-- > 0; )
885            if (keyTable[i] != 0 && valueTable[i] == value) return true;
886        return false;
887    }
888
889    public boolean containsKey(int key) {
890        if (key == 0) return hasZeroValue;
891        int index = key & mask;
892        if (keyTable[index] != key) {
893            index = hash2(key);
894            if (keyTable[index] != key) {
895                index = hash3(key);
896                if (keyTable[index] != key) return containsKeyStash(key);
897            }
898        }
899        return true;
900    }
901
902    private boolean containsKeyStash(int key) {
903        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
904        for (int i = capacity, n = i + stashSize; i < n; i++)
905            if (key == keyTable[i]) return true;
906        return false;
907    }
908
909    /**
910     * Returns the key for the specified char value, or notFound if it is not in the map. Note this traverses the
911     * entire map and compares every value, which may be an expensive operation.
912     */
913    public int findKey(char value, int notFound) {
914        if (hasZeroValue && zeroChar == value) return 0;
915        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
916        char[] valueTable = this.charValueTable;
917        for (int i = capacity + stashSize; i-- > 0; )
918            if (keyTable[i] != 0 && valueTable[i] == value) return keyTable[i];
919        return notFound;
920    }
921
922    /**
923     * Returns the key for the specified float value, or notFound if it is not in the map. Note this traverses the
924     * entire map and compares every value, which may be an expensive operation.
925     */
926    public int findKey(float value, int notFound) {
927        if (hasZeroValue && zeroFloat == value) return 0;
928        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
929        float[] valueTable = this.floatValueTable;
930        for (int i = capacity + stashSize; i-- > 0; )
931            if (keyTable[i] != 0 && valueTable[i] == value) return keyTable[i];
932        return notFound;
933    }
934
935    /**
936     * Increases the size of the backing array to accommodate the specified number of additional items. Useful before adding many
937     * items to avoid multiple backing array resizes.
938     */
939    public void ensureCapacity(int additionalCapacity) {
940        int sizeNeeded = size + additionalCapacity;
941        if (sizeNeeded >= threshold) resize(HashCommon.nextPowerOfTwo((int) Math.ceil(sizeNeeded / loadFactor)));
942    }
943
944    private void resize(int newSize) {
945        int oldEndIndex = capacity + stashSize;
946
947        capacity = newSize;
948        threshold = (int) (newSize * loadFactor);
949        mask = newSize - 1;
950        hashShift = 31 - Integer.numberOfTrailingZeros(newSize);
951        stashCapacity = Math.max(3, (int) Math.ceil(Math.log(newSize)) * 2);
952        pushIterations = Math.max(Math.min(newSize, 8), (int) Math.sqrt(newSize) / 8);
953
954        int[] oldKeyTable = keyTable;
955        char[] oldCharTable = charValueTable;
956        float[] oldFloatTable = floatValueTable;
957
958        keyTable = new int[newSize + stashCapacity];
959        charValueTable = new char[newSize + stashCapacity];
960        floatValueTable = new float[newSize + stashCapacity];
961
962        int oldSize = size;
963        size = hasZeroValue ? 1 : 0;
964        stashSize = 0;
965        if (oldSize > 0) {
966            for (int i = 0; i < oldEndIndex; i++) {
967                int key = oldKeyTable[i];
968                if (key != EMPTY) putResize(key, oldCharTable[i], oldFloatTable[i]);
969            }
970        }
971    }
972
973    private int hash2(int h) {
974        h *= PRIME2;
975        return (h ^ h >>> hashShift) & mask;
976    }
977
978    private int hash3(int h) {
979        h *= PRIME3;
980        return (h ^ h >>> hashShift) & mask;
981    }
982
983    public int hashCode() {
984        int h = 0;
985        if (hasZeroValue) {
986            // 0x1FFF is a Mersenne prime; multiplication by powers of 2 plus or minus 1 is often optimized
987            h = NumberTools.floatToIntBits(zeroFloat) ^ (zeroChar * 0x1FFF);
988        }
989        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
990        char[] charTable = this.charValueTable;
991        float[] floatTable = this.floatValueTable;
992        for (int i = 0, n = capacity + stashSize; i < n; i++) {
993            int key = keyTable[i];
994            if (key != EMPTY) {
995                h += key * 31 + NumberTools.floatToIntBits(floatTable[i]);
996                h ^= charTable[i] * 0x1FFF;
997            }
998        }
999        return h;
1000    }
1001
1002    public boolean equals(Object obj) {
1003        if (obj == this) return true;
1004        if (!(obj instanceof SparseTextMap)) return false;
1005        SparseTextMap other = (SparseTextMap) obj;
1006        if (other.size != size) return false;
1007        if (other.hasZeroValue != hasZeroValue) return false;
1008        if (hasZeroValue && (other.zeroChar != zeroChar || other.zeroFloat != zeroFloat)) {
1009            return false;
1010        }
1011        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
1012        char[] valueTable = this.charValueTable;
1013        for (int i = 0, n = capacity + stashSize; i < n; i++) {
1014            int key = keyTable[i];
1015            if (key != EMPTY) {
1016                char otherValue = other.getChar(key, '\0');
1017                if (otherValue == 0 && !other.containsKey(key)) return false;
1018                int value = valueTable[i];
1019                if (otherValue != value) return false;
1020            }
1021        }
1022        return true;
1023    }
1024
1025    public String toString() {
1026        if (size == 0) return "{}";
1027        StringBuilder buffer = new StringBuilder(32);
1028        buffer.append('{');
1029        int[] keyTable = this.keyTable;
1030        char[] charTable = this.charValueTable;
1031        float[] floatTable = this.floatValueTable;
1032        int i = keyTable.length;
1033        if (hasZeroValue) {
1034            StringKit.appendHex(buffer.append("0=").append(zeroChar).append(','), zeroFloat);
1035        } else {
1036            while (i-- > 0) {
1037                int key = keyTable[i];
1038                if (key == EMPTY) continue;
1039                StringKit.appendHex(buffer.append(key).append('=').append(charTable[i]).append(','), floatTable[i]);
1040                break;
1041            }
1042        }
1043        while (i-- > 0) {
1044            int key = keyTable[i];
1045            if (key == EMPTY) continue;
1046            StringKit.appendHex(buffer.append("; ").append(key).append('=').append(charTable[i]).append(','), floatTable[i]);
1047        }
1048        buffer.append('}');
1049        return buffer.toString();
1050    }
1051
1052    public Iterator<Entry> iterator() {
1053        return entries();
1054    }
1055
1056    /**
1057     * Returns an iterator for the entries in the map. Remove is supported. Note that the same iterator instance is returned each
1058     * time this method is called. Use the {@link Entries} constructor for nested or multithreaded iteration.
1059     */
1060    public Entries entries() {
1061        if (entries1 == null) {
1062            entries1 = new Entries(this);
1063            entries2 = new Entries(this);
1064        }
1065        if (!entries1.valid) {
1066            entries1.reset();
1067            entries1.valid = true;
1068            entries2.valid = false;
1069            return entries1;
1070        }
1071        entries2.reset();
1072        entries2.valid = true;
1073        entries1.valid = false;
1074        return entries2;
1075    }
1076
1077    /**
1078     * Returns an iterator for the values in the map. Remove is supported. Note that the same iterator instance is returned each
1079     * time this method is called. Use the {@link Entries} constructor for nested or multithreaded iteration.
1080     */
1081    public CharValues charValues() {
1082        if (charValues1 == null) {
1083            charValues1 = new CharValues(this);
1084            charValues2 = new CharValues(this);
1085        }
1086        if (!charValues1.valid) {
1087            charValues1.reset();
1088            charValues1.valid = true;
1089            charValues2.valid = false;
1090            return charValues1;
1091        }
1092        charValues2.reset();
1093        charValues2.valid = true;
1094        charValues1.valid = false;
1095        return charValues2;
1096    }
1097
1098    /**
1099     * Returns an iterator for the values in the map. Remove is supported. Note that the same iterator instance is returned each
1100     * time this method is called. Use the {@link Entries} constructor for nested or multithreaded iteration.
1101     */
1102    public FloatValues floatValues() {
1103        if (floatValues1 == null) {
1104            floatValues1 = new FloatValues(this);
1105            floatValues2 = new FloatValues(this);
1106        }
1107        if (!floatValues1.valid) {
1108            floatValues1.reset();
1109            floatValues1.valid = true;
1110            floatValues2.valid = false;
1111            return floatValues1;
1112        }
1113        floatValues2.reset();
1114        floatValues2.valid = true;
1115        floatValues1.valid = false;
1116        return floatValues2;
1117    }
1118
1119    /**
1120     * Returns an iterator for the keys in the map. Remove is supported. Note that the same iterator instance is returned each time
1121     * this method is called. Use the {@link Entries} constructor for nested or multithreaded iteration.
1122     */
1123    public Keys keys() {
1124        if (keys1 == null) {
1125            keys1 = new Keys(this);
1126            keys2 = new Keys(this);
1127        }
1128        if (!keys1.valid) {
1129            keys1.reset();
1130            keys1.valid = true;
1131            keys2.valid = false;
1132            return keys1;
1133        }
1134        keys2.reset();
1135        keys2.valid = true;
1136        keys1.valid = false;
1137        return keys2;
1138    }
1139
1140    static public class Entry {
1141        public int key;
1142        public char charValue;
1143        public float floatValue;
1144
1145        public String toString() {
1146            return key + "=" + charValue + "," + floatValue;
1147        }
1148    }
1149
1150    static private class MapIterator {
1151        static final int INDEX_ILLEGAL = -2;
1152        static final int INDEX_ZERO = -1;
1153
1154        public boolean hasNext;
1155
1156        final SparseTextMap map;
1157        int nextIndex, currentIndex;
1158        boolean valid = true;
1159
1160        public MapIterator(SparseTextMap map) {
1161            this.map = map;
1162            reset();
1163        }
1164
1165        public void reset() {
1166            currentIndex = INDEX_ILLEGAL;
1167            nextIndex = INDEX_ZERO;
1168            if (map.hasZeroValue)
1169                hasNext = true;
1170            else
1171                findNextIndex();
1172        }
1173
1174        void findNextIndex() {
1175            hasNext = false;
1176            int[] keyTable = map.keyTable;
1177            for (int n = map.capacity + map.stashSize; ++nextIndex < n; ) {
1178                if (keyTable[nextIndex] != EMPTY) {
1179                    hasNext = true;
1180                    break;
1181                }
1182            }
1183        }
1184
1185        public void remove() {
1186            if (currentIndex == INDEX_ZERO && map.hasZeroValue) {
1187                map.hasZeroValue = false;
1188            } else if (currentIndex < 0) {
1189                throw new IllegalStateException("next must be called before remove.");
1190            } else if (currentIndex >= map.capacity) {
1191                map.removeStashIndex(currentIndex);
1192                nextIndex = currentIndex - 1;
1193                findNextIndex();
1194            } else {
1195                map.keyTable[currentIndex] = EMPTY;
1196            }
1197            currentIndex = INDEX_ILLEGAL;
1198            map.size--;
1199        }
1200    }
1201
1202    static public class Entries extends MapIterator implements Iterable<Entry>, Iterator<Entry> {
1203        private Entry entry = new Entry();
1204
1205        public Entries(SparseTextMap map) {
1206            super(map);
1207        }
1208
1209        /**
1210         * Note the same entry instance is returned each time this method is called.
1211         */
1212        public Entry next() {
1213            if (!hasNext) throw new NoSuchElementException();
1214            if (!valid) throw new GdxRuntimeException("#iterator() cannot be used nested.");
1215            if (nextIndex == INDEX_ZERO) {
1216                entry.key = 0;
1217                entry.charValue = map.zeroChar;
1218                entry.floatValue = map.zeroFloat;
1219            } else {
1220                entry.key = map.keyTable[nextIndex];
1221                entry.charValue = map.charValueTable[nextIndex];
1222                entry.floatValue = map.floatValueTable[nextIndex];
1223            }
1224            currentIndex = nextIndex;
1225            findNextIndex();
1226            return entry;
1227        }
1228
1229        public boolean hasNext() {
1230            if (!valid) throw new GdxRuntimeException("#iterator() cannot be used nested.");
1231            return hasNext;
1232        }
1233
1234        public Iterator<Entry> iterator() {
1235            return this;
1236        }
1237
1238        public void remove() {
1239            super.remove();
1240        }
1241    }
1242
1243    static public class CharValues extends MapIterator {
1244        public CharValues(SparseTextMap map) {
1245            super(map);
1246        }
1247
1248        public boolean hasNext() {
1249            if (!valid) throw new GdxRuntimeException("#iterator() cannot be used nested.");
1250            return hasNext;
1251        }
1252
1253        public char next() {
1254            if (!hasNext) throw new NoSuchElementException();
1255            if (!valid) throw new GdxRuntimeException("#iterator() cannot be used nested.");
1256            char value;
1257            if (nextIndex == INDEX_ZERO)
1258                value = map.zeroChar;
1259            else
1260                value = map.charValueTable[nextIndex];
1261            currentIndex = nextIndex;
1262            findNextIndex();
1263            return value;
1264        }
1265
1266        /**
1267         * Returns a new array containing the remaining values.
1268         */
1269        public char[] toArray() {
1270            char[] array = new char[map.size];
1271            int idx = 0;
1272            while (hasNext && idx < array.length)
1273                array[idx++] = next();
1274            return array;
1275        }
1276    }
1277
1278    static public class FloatValues extends MapIterator {
1279        public FloatValues(SparseTextMap map) {
1280            super(map);
1281        }
1282
1283        public boolean hasNext() {
1284            if (!valid) throw new GdxRuntimeException("#iterator() cannot be used nested.");
1285            return hasNext;
1286        }
1287
1288        public float next() {
1289            if (!hasNext) throw new NoSuchElementException();
1290            if (!valid) throw new GdxRuntimeException("#iterator() cannot be used nested.");
1291            float value;
1292            if (nextIndex == INDEX_ZERO)
1293                value = map.zeroFloat;
1294            else
1295                value = map.floatValueTable[nextIndex];
1296            currentIndex = nextIndex;
1297            findNextIndex();
1298            return value;
1299        }
1300
1301        /**
1302         * Returns a new array containing the remaining values.
1303         */
1304        public float[] toArray() {
1305            float[] array = new float[map.size];
1306            int idx = 0;
1307            while (hasNext && idx < array.length)
1308                array[idx++] = next();
1309            return array;
1310        }
1311    }
1312
1313    static public class Keys extends MapIterator {
1314        public Keys(SparseTextMap map) {
1315            super(map);
1316        }
1317
1318        public boolean hasNext() {
1319            if (!valid) throw new GdxRuntimeException("#iterator() cannot be used nested.");
1320            return hasNext;
1321        }
1322
1323        public int next() {
1324            if (!hasNext) throw new NoSuchElementException();
1325            if (!valid) throw new GdxRuntimeException("#iterator() cannot be used nested.");
1326            int key = nextIndex == INDEX_ZERO ? 0 : map.keyTable[nextIndex];
1327            currentIndex = nextIndex;
1328            findNextIndex();
1329            return key;
1330        }
1331
1332        /**
1333         * Returns a new array containing the remaining keys.
1334         */
1335        public int[] toArray() {
1336            int[] array = new int[map.size];
1337            int idx = 0;
1338            while (hasNext && idx < array.length)
1339                array[idx++] = next();
1340            return array;
1341        }
1342    }
1343}
